column4: a few months ago someone helpful here told me the command and I used it to enable the bytecode interpreter on my warthy
however, I forgot it and I just installed hoary
I might be wrong, but it was something like fontconfig-something
guys, if you don't know, just tell me so..
people used to be more helpful last time I was around...hope #ubuntu doesn't become #debian in the near future...:(
anyway...there could be that #ubuntu will become #debian, since ubuntu IS debian!
wild guess, but tried ~ > sudo dpkg-reconfigure fontconfig
increase your history in your shell ;)
my brain is reconfiguring command priority in available memory...
